text:
Harper: Mrs. Barker comes
into the cafe all the time.

I can't believe 
I never recognized her.

I mean, Savannah is,
like, 70 now.

She's still
the same person, Griffin.

Something should've seemed,
I don't know, familiar.

She got married
and she lived this whole life,

and it'd be crazy
if she wasn't any different.

I mean, think about how much
our parents changed

Hey, what do you think
we'll be like at their age?

Taller.
At least I better be.

Would we still
recognize each other
if we passed on the street?

Come on. You know
you're pretty unforgettable.
